channel.title: Holy Shit - Hard Drive Prices?//
channel.description: Well I know the flooding in Thailand thing has ass raped hard drive prices but when the fuck are they going to go back down? I was going to build a home server with around 6tb of harddrive space but with these prices its not even worth it. What were the prices for 1tb harddrives before the flood? And is there anywhere in the US I can still get harddrives cheap?

item.title: Holy Shit - Hard Drive Prices?//
item.dc:creator: @The_Un-Named The Un-Named
item.description:
@The_Un-Named wrote:

[quote=“mwiebelhaus, post:5, topic:426028”][quote author=Speljohan link=topic=528715.msg3856474#msg3856474 date=1324388290]

2TB 5400rpm sata drives cost £56 ish before the flood, can cost anything from £100 to £150+ after the floods

it’s likely prices won’t go down until well until 2012 and won’t return to normal for a long time
[/quote]That. It should start to go down around summer 2012, but it’ll probably take far longer for it to actually stabilize again.

If there’s no supply, they can’t very well sell anything.

So do you guys thing prices are going to keep going up?[/quote]

prices haven’t been too consistent, I’m sure most websites have no idea what to do so it’s hard to tell which way the prices will go

Read full topic

item.title: Holy Shit - Hard Drive Prices?//

[quote=“mwiebelhaus, post:5, topic:426028”][quote author=Speljohan link=topic=528715.msg3856474#msg3856474 date=1324388290]

it’s likely prices won’t go down until well until 2012 and won’t return to normal for a long time
[/quote]That. It should start to go down around summer 2012, but it’ll probably take far longer for it to actually stabilize again.

If there’s no supply, they can’t very well sell anything.

So do you guys thing prices are going to keep going up?[/quote]Doubtful, it’ll probably stay around this.
